title.@value: Pneumothorax originating in the perinatal period

definition.@value: Abnormal presence of air or other gas in the pleural cavity, usually secondary to tracking of free air from pulmonary interstitial emphysema, or rupture of subpleural blebs.

longDefinition.@value: Abnormal presence of air or other gas in the pleural cavity, usually secondary to tracking of free air from pulmonary interstitial emphysema, or rupture of subpleural blebs that can be associated with mediastinal shift with kinking of the great vessels and impaired cardiac output

label.@value: Pneumothorax originating in the perinatal period
